THIS PROJECT WILL ENGAGE CORE GROUPS OF HMONG, BURMESE, AND AFGHAN NEWIMMIGRANTS WHO HAVE EXPERIENCE AND INTEREST IN BUILDING AGRICULTURALBUSINESSES. PROJECT PARTNERS WILL WORK TO BUILD AN AGRICULTURAL NETWORKWITHIN EACH IMMIGRANT GROUP AND LINK THEM TO USDA, STATE, AND LOCALAGRICULTURE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

HMONG AMERICAN PARTNERSHIPS, AS THE NATION'S LEADER IN SERVING THE HMONGAND THE SOUTHEAST COMMUNITIES, WILL USE ITS EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE TOPROVIDE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE SUPPORT AND SERVICESTO EMERGING FARMERS AND RANCHERS.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE AN OPPORTUNITY TO ACTIVELY REACHAND TEACH ACTIVE MILITARY, VETERANS, MILITARY FAMILY MEMBERS,MINORITIES, AND YOUTH WHO ARE INTERESTED IN AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION AS ASOURCE OF INCOME, MENTAL HEALTH AND STRESS MANAGEMENT, AND BUSINESSTRAINING.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST BIPOC FARMERS IN RETAINING,EXPANDING, AND SUSTAINABLY UTILIZING THEIR LANDHOLDINGS. THE PROJECTWILL ALSO ENCOURAGE FARMERS TO GAIN EQUITABLE ACCESS AND UTILIZATION OFALL USDA PROGRAMS, RESOURCES, AND SERVICES.

THE GOAL  OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD A COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL LITERACYAND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM THAT WOULD POSITION FARMERS TO FULLYUNDERSTAND THEIR FINANCIAL SITUATION AND ENABLE THEM TO ACCESS THEFINANCIAL CAPITAL THEY NEED TO MAKE THEIR FARMS VIABLE.

THE GOAL IS TO INCLUDE TECHNOLOGY WHILE INFORMING PARTICIPANTS OF USDAPROGRAMS, AND IMPLEMENTING AN EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH PROGRAM TO IMPROVESDVFRS FARM INCOME AND ENHANCE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH BETTER FARMMANAGEMENT PRACTICES.

TO EXPAND THE NUMBER OF SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED AQUACULTURE FARMERS ANDSTRENGTHEN CAPACITY AND RESILIENCY OF EXISTING FARMERS IN THE FSM AND HAWAII THROUGH TRAINING AND TECHNICAL OUTREACH IN ESTABLISHEDAQUACULTURE TECHNIQUES.

THE NATIONAL IMMIGRANT FARMING INITIATIVE OR NIFI WILL ASSIST MAINLYHISPANIC FARMERS AND RANCHERS AND VETERANS IN RUNNING SUCCESSFULAGRICULTURAL BUSINESSES. NIFI WILL SUPPORT PARTICIPATION IN PROGRAMS ANDBUILD RELATIONSHIPS AMONG UNDERSERVED FARMERS AND USDA EXTENSION STAFF.

THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO ASSIST SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGEDAND VETERAN FARMERS AND RANCHERS AND BEGINNING FARMERS AND RANCHERS ONKAUA'I AND O'AHU WITH OWNING AND OPERATING FARMS AND RANCHES ANDENHANCING THEIR CAPACITY TO PARTICIPATE IN THE FULL RANGE OF USDAAGRICULTURAL PROGRAMS FULLY AND EQUITABLY.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION, DIRECT TECHNICALASSISTANCE, AND NETWORK BUILDING FOR SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS INOHIO IN ORDER TO IMPROVE THEIR ABILITY TO OWN AND OPERATE VIABLE FARMS,UTILIZE CLIMATE SMART SUSTAINABLE AG PRACTICES, ACCESS LAND, AND UTILIZEUSDA PROGRAMS.

THE NWIAA PROJECT TARGETS MINORITY WOMEN AND BLACK FARMERS LOOKING TOEXPAND THEIR EXISTING AGRIBUSINESS THROUGH CROP DIVERSIFICATION ANDEXPOSURE TO NEW MARKETS TO INCREASE REVENUE. THE PROJECT PROVIDESTRAINING AND ACCESS TO FINANCIAL RESOURCES.

WITH A FOCUS ON AGRIBUSINESS KNOWLEDGE, BUILDING READY AND RESILIENTVETERAN FARMS WILL FOSTER CONNECTIONS AMONG BEGINNING VETERAN FARMERSAND SERVICE PROVIDERS TO CREATE A SUPPORTIVE NETWORK THAT WILL ENABLEFARMS TO THRIVE.
OUR GOAL IS TO ADDRESS BARRIER CHALLENGES AND INCREASE POTENTIAL FORSUCCESS, FACILITATE CONTINUED OWNERSHIP OF LAND, AND ENHANCE INVOLVEMENTIN AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTION
TO STRENGTHEN THE LONG TERM VIABILITY OF REFUGEE AND IMMIGRANT OWNEDAGRICULTURAL ENTERPRISES BY MAKING COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEMS OF FARM SUPPORTACCESSIBLE AND AVAILABLE
COLLECTIVELY SHAPING A SUSTAINABLE AND EQUITABLE RURAL MISSISSIPPI BYEQUIPPING AND EMPOWERING SDFRS TO SUCCESSFULLY OPERATE, OWN, AND RETAINTHEIR LAND
TO BUILD EACH FARMERS CAPACITY IN MARKET ACCESS, FOOD SAFETY,PRODUCTION, AND RESOURCE ACCESS, RESULTING IN VIABLE SMALL SCALE FARMBUSINESSES THAT ARE ELIGIBLE FOR USDA PROGRAMS
TO ADVANCE FARMING, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, AND ECONOMIC GROWTHOPPORTUNITIES FOR SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND YOUTH, BLACK ANDLOW-INCOME, WITHIN ARKANSAS PULASKIAND LONOKE COUNTIES

SDFRS WILL LEARN HOW TO USE INDIGENOUS FARMING PRACTICES THAT ARE NOWWIDELY RECOGNIZED AS CLIMATE SMART, SUCH AS USE OF SOIL AMENDMENTS ANDCOMPOSTING, AS WELL AS MARKETING, FINANCIAL AND BUSINESS STRATEGIES.
THE OUTCOME OF THIS PROGRAM IS FOR THE FARMERS AND RANCHERSTO HAVE AN OPERATION IN PLACE THAT WILL CREATE AN ECONOMICALLYSUSTAINABLE SYSTEM FOR FARMING, RANCHING AND LANDCONSERVATION.
PROVIDING SUPPORT THROUGH PEER CONNECTORS WHO DELIVER CULTURALLYRELEVANT TRAININGS AND OFFER ONE-ON-ONE SUPPORT TO ASSIST SDFS IN UNDERSTANDING AND ACCESSING USDA RESOURCES.

ASSIST SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED URBAN FARMERS IN RHODE ISLAND TO JUMPSTARTTHEIR FARMS ON LARGER, RURAL SITES AND CONTRIBUTE IN A MORE MEANINGFULWAY TO THE LOCAL FOOD ECONOMY AND TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICALASSISTANCE

TO PROVIDE LANGUAGE APPROPRIATE TRAINING ON FINANCIAL LITERACY, BUSINESSPLANNING, AND CONSERVATION AGRICULTURE IN THREE ASIAN LANGUAGES SUCH ASTHAI, ILOCANO, AND MANDARIN CHINESE, AND IDENTIFIED AS PRIORITYLANGUAGES SPOKEN AMONG FARMERS IN HAWAII
TO INVEST IN THE OZARKS HERITAGE AND IMMIGRANT SPECIALTY CROPS WITHSOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED POPULATIONS WITH THE ADDED SUPPORT OF CONNECTIONSTO CAREER SUPPORT NETWORKS AND RESOURCES

HELPING TRIBAL COMMUNITIES START NEW GARDENS, FARMS, RANCHES OR OTHERENDEAVORS THAT PROMOTE COMMUNITY FOOD SECURITY, RESILIENCY, AND ECONOMICDIVERSITY, WHILE UPHOLDING TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE AND TRADITIONAL WAYS OFSECURING FOOD
THIS PROGRAM WILL TEACH PARTICIPANTS IN THE PROCESS TO START UP THEIRBUSINESS, CREATE A BUSINESS PLAN, FINANCING, NEWEST TECHNOLOGIES, ANDTHE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF THE PUERTO RICAN POPULATION.

PROVIDE ACCESS TO CUSTOMIZED INSTRUCTIONAL AND INFORMATIONAL RESOURCESEMPHASIZING HIGH VISUAL CONTENT, PLAIN LANGUAGE AND PLAIN SPEAKING WILLSTRENGTHEN DELIVERY OF OVERALL OUTREACH, TRAINING AND TECHNICALASSISTANCE.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENGAGE SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED AND VETERANFARMERS AND RANCHERS THROUGH FARM TRAININGS, CURATED LISTENING SESSIONSAND FACILITATION OF AFFINITY GROUPS TO DRIVE APPLICATION SUBMISSIONS,MENTORSHIP, AND CONNECTIONS WITH FSA AND USDA PROGRAM RESOURCES.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO EDUCATE AND DISTRIBUTE RESEARCH-BASEDINFORMATION THAT WILL INFLUENCE THE ABILITY OF UNDERSERVED PROGRAMPARTICIPANTS TO COMPETE AND THRIVE. PARTICIPANTS WILL HAVE THE ABILITYTO APPLY KNOWLEDGE GAINED.

TO BUILD A SUSTAINABLE PRODUCTION, MARKETING, AND DISTRIBUTION SYSTEMFOR SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED LATINX FARMERS IN THE WESTERN OREGON REGIONTHROUGH THE PRODUCTION AND MARKETING OF HIGH VALUE SPECIALTY CROPS.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO BUILD ON A COALITION OF HMONG-LEDORGANIZATIONS AND FARM ORGANIZATIONS TO HELP ASIAN-AMERICAN FARMERS INWISCONSIN ACCESS USDA PROGRAMS, REACH ADDITIONAL MARKETS, AND GETSUPPORT FOR HMOOB FARMERS TO ATTEND ESTABLISHED FARM CONFERENCES ANDFIELD DAYS.
TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION IN URBAN FARM SYSTEMS SETUP,OPERATIONS, FOOD HANDLING, SUSTAINABLE PACKAGING, MARKETING, ANDDISTRIBUTION TO SDVFRS IN ILLINOIS.

THE GOAL IS TO EMPOWER SDVFRS AND ASSIST THEM BUILD RESILIENT FARMSTHROUGH INCREASED PROGRAM PARTICIPATION AND IMPROVED FARM MANAGEMENTSKILLS ACQUIRED THROUGH FINANCIAL EDUCATION, HEIRS' PROPERTY OR ESTATEPLANNING, EXPERIENCED-BASED TRAINING AND COLLABORATIVE MENTORINGPROGRAMS.
TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO AFRICAN AMERICANFARMERS AND RURAL RESIDENTS IN A 20 COUNTY AREA OF THE ALABAMA BLACKBELT.

TO PROVIDE NATIVE AMERICAN FARMERS, RANCHERS, AND COMMUNITY FOODPRODUCERS WITH INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND ACCESS TO USDA PROGRAMS ANDSERVICES; BEST PRACTICES TO PROMOTE SOUND FINANCIAL AND AGRIBUSINESSMANAGEMENT TO INCREASE SUCCESS AND SUSTAINABILITY OF OPERATIONS.

TO ASSIST SDVFRS BY CONNECTING THEM WITH USDA RESOURCES TO PROVIDE MOREMARKET OPPORTUNITIES AND GROWTH FOR THEIR BUSINESSES.  WILL PROVIDEMONTHLY WORKSHOPS AND FORUMS ON AGTECH, PRECISION AGRICULTURE, GOOD AGPRACTICES, TECHNOLOGY TRAINING, TECH ASSISTANCE, AND DEVELOPING BUSINESSAND MARKETING PLANS.  BILINGUAL WORKSHOPS WILL BE OFFERED.
TO ADAPT FARMING PRACTICES TO MEET ALASKA'S CHANGING CLIMATE AND TOCONNECT SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED REFUGEE FARMERS WITH USDA RESOURCES.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE LINGUISTICALLY AND CULTURALLYAPPROPRIATE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR REFUGEE FARMERS WHOOPERATE INCUBATOR FARM PLOTS AT THE GLOBAL GARDEN REFUGEE TRAINING FARMAND FOR OTHER REFUGEES INTERESTED IN LEARNING ABOUT VEGETABLE FARMING INTHE MIDWESTERN UNITED STATES.

THROUGH ENTERPRISE SPECIFIC WORKSHOPS AND PROGRAMMING, FARMERS WILL HOSTON FARM WORKSHOPS THAT WILL COMPLIMENT ONLINE BUSINESS CLASSES. CONSERVATION PRACTICES AND PROGRAMS WILL BE HIGHLIGHTED IN FARMINARSTHAT WILL SUPPLEMENT CONTENT POSTED ONLINE.  WILL PROVIDE RESOURCES ANDTECHNICAL ADVISORS.

TO ASSIST SDVFRS AND YOUTH THROUGH COLLABORATION AT INCUBATOR FARM ANDFOOD HUB SITES THROUGH HANDS ON ORGANIC AG TRAINING, BUSINESS PLANNING,WEBINARS AND RESOURCE FAIRS CONNECTING THEM WITH USDA RESOURCES.

TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES IN REGENERATIVE AND CLIMATERESPONSIVE AG AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT THAT PROVIDES BOTH CLASSROOM ANDHANDS ON LEARNING TO TRAIN FARMERS IN GROWING TECHNIQUES THAT REDUCE THEIMPACT OF AGRICULTURE ON THE ENVIRONMENT AND PREPARE THEM FOR SUCCESSFULSTARTUP AND MANAGEMENT OF FARM BUSINESSES.

TO PROVIDE OUTREACH, TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND NETWORKINGOPPORTUNITIES TO SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED NASAP FARMERS TO LEVERAGEFEDERAL AND STATE NUTRITION AND FOOD ACCESS PROGRAMS TO ENGAGE FUTUREFARMERS WHILE FOSTERING COLLABORATION BETWEEN THEM AND PUBLIC ENTITIES,FUNDERS, AND LENDERS TOWARD A STRONGER AGRICULTURAL SECTOR.

TO OFFER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN GOOD AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES, FOODSAFETY MODERNIZATION ACT (FSMA) TRAINING, ONE ON ONE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WITH FARMS SEEKING GAPS AUDITS, FSMA COMPLIANCE, AND FOR FARMERS SEEKING TO ADD COMMERCIAL AG VENTURES TO THEIR PROPERTY.
TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO CAPITAL PROGRAMS AND SERVICES BOTH IN PERSON ANDVIRTUALLY TO ALIGN AND LEVERAGE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SOURCES OF CAPITAL TOENCOURAGE INCREASED INVESTMENT IN SDFRS.

TO ASSIST SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCERS AND YOUTH WITH A NETWORK OFTRAINING PARTNERS THAT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCEWITH THE SKILLS AND TOOLS TO MAKE GOOD FARM BUSINESS DECISIONS ANDENHANCE ENTERPRISE SUSTAINABILITY BY PARTICIPATING IN COOPERATIVEENTITIES IN THE LOCAL MEAT VALUE CHAIN.
THE MISSION OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE GENERATIONAL WEALTH, ECONOMICVALUE, AND COMMUNITY STABILITY BY SECURING AND PRESERVING PROPERTYRIGHTS OF LOW AND MODERATE INCOME GEORGIANS.

TO PROVIDE OUTREACH AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ENABLE SOCIALLYDISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND YOUTH TO ACCESS USDA PROGRAMS TO OVERCOMEEQUITY RELATED PROBLEMS, PROBLEMS RELATED TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND THEPANDEMIC, IMPROVE THEIR FARM BUSINESSES, AND ATTRACT NEW AND BEGINNINGSOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS WITH NO PRACTICAL EXPERIENCE INTO FARMINGAND AG RELATED CAREERS.

THE PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO HELP SUPPRESS THE MIGRATIONS OF SOCIALLYUNDERSERVED, MINORITY, VETERANS, AND FARMERS AND RANCHERS OR SUMVFRS INFLORIDA FROM AGRICULTURE BY ELIMINATING OR MITIGATING THE FACTORS THATCAUSE FARMS OWNED BY THE TARGETED AUDIENCE TO FAIL.

TO CREATE AND FACILITATE A PLATFORM TO SHARE INFORMATION AND RESOURCESAND TO PROVIDE TRAINING, EDUCATION, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO NATIVEFARMERS AND RANCHERS IN CLIMATE SMART CONSERVATION, REGENERATIVE AG, ANDURBAN AG PRACTICES TO INCREASE MARKETS AND BUSINESS ENTERPRISES.
THROUGH OUTREACH, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND EDUCATION, THE PROJECT WILLEXPAND THE ACCESS AND SUCCESS OF NEW SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED AND VETERANFARMERS IN PURSUING FARMING AND ACCESSING USDA PROGRAMS.
TO LEVERAGE ORGANIZATIONAL SUPPLY CHAIN AGGREGATION CAPACITY ANDTECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO INCREASE THE WHOLESALE READINESS FOR SDFRS TOPARTICIPATE AS VENDORS IN DOL FOOD HUB.

FROM FOOD DESERTS TO FARMS: CIVIL AGRICULTURE IN ALASKA WILL EXPAND THENUMBER OF SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED/ VETERAN FARMERS IN RURAL ALASKAVILLAGES THROUGH EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS THAT INCLUDE A LAND-BASED FARMSCHOOL TO ADDRESS OBSTACLES OF BEGINNING FARMERS. THE THREE-YEAR PROGRAMCOMBINES HANDS-ON TRAINING, COUPLED WITH ONLINE COURSES ON SUSTAINABLEFARMING PRACTICES WITH AGRICULTURE-RELATED DIGITAL RESOURCES WITHSPECIFIC LEARNING OUTCOMES, REQUIRED SKILLS, AND ASSOCIATED PROFICIENCY.THE PROGRAM WILL RAISE AWARENESS ON FOOD ISSUES, ASSIST FARMERS INAPPLYING FOR USDAPROGRAMS, AND TEACH MANAGEMENT AND BUDGETING SKILLS.
BUILDING VIABILITY OF SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMS IN OHIO USINGOUTREACH, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND USDA PROGRAMS

PEER TEACHERS: A KEY CONNECTION BETWEEN IMMIGRANT AND REFUGEE FARMERSAND USDA AND LOCAL RESOURCES: “PEER TEACHERS: A KEY CONNECTION BETWEENIMMIGRANT AND REFUGEE FARMERS AND USDA AND LOCAL RESOURCES.” THE GOAL OFTHIS PROJECT IS TO ACCELERATE THE GROWTH AND PRODUCTIVITY OF FARMSOPERATED BY REFUGEE AND IMMIGRANT FARMERS IN THE SPRINGFIELD,MASSACHUSETTS METRO AREA (HAMPDEN COUNTY) AND TO ASSIST THOSE FARMS INPARTICIPATING IN USDA PROGRAMS. INVESTING IN REFUGEE AND IMMIGRANT PEERTEACHERS IS AN ENDURING RESOURCE TO THE REFUGEE AND IMMIGRANT FARMINGCOMMUNITY AND THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE, LEADING TO MORE PRODUCTIVE FARMSAND GARDENS AND INCREASED FRESH FOOD ACCESS IN DIVERSE URBANNEIGHBORHOODS. PEER TEACHERS WILL SERVE AS A BRIDGE BETWEEN TRADITIONALSERVICE PROVIDERS AND THE USDA AND IMMIGRANT AND REFUGEE FARMERS,PROVIDING TRAINING IN FARMERS’ NATIVE LANGUAGES AND WITH ANUNDERSTANDING OF THEIR CULTURAL AND FARMING BACKGROUNDS. THEACTIVITIES AND OUTCOMES OF THE CURRENT PROJECT WILL ENABLE FARMERS TOMAKE SOUND MANAGEMENT DECISIONS ON CURRENT AND FUTURE LAND, ENHANCE THEPRODUCTIVITY OF THEIR EFFORTS, AND ACCESS USDA PROGRAMS. AS A RESULT,FARMERS WILL BRING A BOUNTY OF FRESH, CULTURAL PRODUCE INTO THE FOODDESERTS WHERE THEY LIVE WELL INTO THE FUTURE.

KFVS GIVE ME MY HEIRS PROPERTY: ITS MINE PROJECT: THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE HEIR PROPERTY ASSESSMENT, STRATEGIC REVIEW AND PROPERTYRESTORATION TO RIGHTFUL HEIR OWNERS, BUSINESS AND FINANCIAL DEVELOPMENT SERVICES INCLUDING FARM/BUSINESS PLAN, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, USDA LOAN INFORMATION, QUICKBOOKS. MARKETING EDUCATION TO SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS. RANCHERS OVER A 3 YEAR PERIOD. THE FARMERS ARE ENGAGED IN FARMING OPERATIONS IN THE HIGH DESERT/INLAND EMPIRE OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA, THE RURAL AREA FARMING COMMUNITY FOR SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA. 1. KFV/HEIR PROPERTYASSESSMENT 2. KFV BUSINESS INSTITUTE INCLUDING BUSINESS COACHING, WITH PARTNER HEIRS PROPERTY PROJECT USDA LOAN INFORMATION, FARM/BUSINESS PLANS, QUICKBOOKS. MARKETING OF SOUTHERN CA. THESE CLASSES WILL ENABLE EACH FARMER TO EXPAND/ELEVATE FARMING OPERATIONS COUPLED WITH INCREASING THEIR PROFITABILITY, SUSTAINABILITY, EFFICIENCY OF OPERATIONS, PRODUCTIVITY, DIVERSITY AND FLEXIBILITY.

NAUT'STAAWISTET-DEVELOPING KONIAG ALUTIIQ FARMERS: THE OVERALL GOAL OFTHIS THREE-YEAR PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A REGIONALNETWORK OF ALASKA NATIVE FARMERS IN THE ALUTIIQ HOMELAND OF THE KODIAKARCHIPELAGO IN SUPPORT OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND REGIONALFOOD SECURITY. THE PROJECT’S THREE OBJECTIVES FOCUS ON THE DELIVERY OFAN ANNUAL CYCLE OF TECHNICAL TRAINING AND INFORMATION THAT INCLUDESBEGINNING FARMERS FROM ALL SIX OF THE ARCHIPELAGO’S COMMUNITIES OFAKHIOK, KODIAK, LARSEN BAY, OLD HARBOR, OUZINKIE AND PORT LIONS. ATLEAST 25 ALASKA NATIVES WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT’S TECHNICALASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES, AT LEAST 8 ALASKA NATIVE OWNED FARMS WILL OBTAINFINANCIAL AND OPERATIONAL SUSTAINABILITY BY SEPTEMBER 2023.GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREA: KODIAK ARCHIPELAGO, ALASKA

THE BECAROLINE COORDINATION HUB (BECCH): A BROKERAGE HUB THAT CONNECTSSOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS, RANCHERS, <(>&<)> VETERAN FARMERS TOTECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, RESOURCES, ORGANIZATIONS, LAND, INFRASTRUCTURE

BUILDING SUSTAINABLE FARM BUSINESSES FOR SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED ANDVETERAN FARMERS AND RANCHERS: THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TOEQUIP SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED AND VETERAN FARMERS AND RANCHERS (SDVFR) INNORTH CAROLINA WITH THE TOOLS AND SKILLS NEEDED FOR THEM TO BUILDSUSTAINABLE AND PROFITABLE FARM BUSINESSES, WHILE INCREASING THEIRPARTICIPATION IN U.S DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE (USDA) PROGRAMS. EXPECTEDRESULTS OF THE PROJECT, ARE AN ENHANCED ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES AND ANIMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE OF SDVFR, THEIR FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES. THESUPPORTING OBJECTIVES ARE: 1) IMPROVE AWARENESS AND INCREASEPARTICIPATION AMONG SOCIALLYDISADVANTAGED AND VETERAN FARMERS AND RANCHERS IN USDA FARM PROGRAMS ANDSERVICES. 2) IMPROVE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF SDVFR IN FARM FINANCIALAND BUSINESS PLANNING, AND MANAGEMENT. 3) ENHANCE THE ABILITIES FORSDVFR TO TRANSFER, OWN AND RETAIN FARMLANDS SUCCESSFULLY. 4) ENHANCE THEKNOWLEDGE OF SDVBFR IN IDENTIFYING AND ADOPTING ENVIRONMENTALLY SOUNDAND PROFITABLE ALTERNATIVE FARM ENTERPRISES THROUGH INNOVATIVE ANDCOST-EFFECTIVEPRODUCTION PRACTICES. 5) INCREASE MARKETING ACTIVITIES FOR SDVFR,IDENTIFY NEW MARKETS, CONNECTING THEM TO EXISTING MARKETS, AND ASSISTTHEM WITH EFFECTIVE MARKETING STRATEGIES. THE PROJECT WILL INVOLVEACTIVITIES IN PLANNING, PRODUCTION AND MARKETING OF TESTED ANDMARKETABLE HIGH VALUE CROPS AND LIVESTOCK. USING OUTREACH,TRAINING, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE APPROACH, A VARIETY OF TOPICS WILL BEADDRESSED TO PROVIDE SDVFR WITH THE INFORMATION AND SKILLS NEEDED FORTHEM TO SUSTAINABLY OPERATE SUCCESSFUL FARM BUSINESSES, WHILE INCREASINGTHEIR PARTICIPATION IN USDA PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THE PROJECT TARGETSSOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED AND VETERAN FARMERS ANDRANCHERS IN FOURTEEN NORTH CAROLINIAN COUNTIES.

OUTREACH AND ASSISTANCE FOR SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS AND RANCHERSTRAINING, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON GRANT’S READINESS ANDGRANTSMANSHIP IN PUERTO RICO: PRAES WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OUTREACHEFFORTS TO CONNECT WITH AND ASSIST SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED AND VETERANFARMERS AND RANCHERS AND TO PROVIDE THEM WITH INFORMATION AVAILABLE ONUSDA RESOURCES. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL BUILD ON A SUCCESSFULPREVIOUSLY FUNDED GRANT UNDER THE SAMEPROGRAM, IMPACTING NEW FARMERS AND RANCHERS AND, PROVIDING CONTINUITY TOTHOSE THAT ALREADY SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED PRIOR WORKSHOPS LEADING TO THECOMPLETION OF REQUESTS FOR USDA FUNDED PROGRAMS. THE PRIMARYPOPULATIONS/COMMUNITIES: PUERTO RICO, RURAL COMMUNITY, HIGH POVERTYAREAS.

HOOMAHUAHUA PROJECT: SUSTAINABLE MOLOKAI'S HO‘OM?HUAHUA PROJECT WILLTAKE PLACE IN THE COUNTY OF MAUI ON THE ISLAND OF MOLOKAI, HAWAII,WHICH HAS A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 7,500 PEOPLE, WITH 62% OF NATIVEHAWAIIAN ANCESTRY. THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO GROW THE NUMBER OFSOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED (SD) BEGINNING FARMERS ON THE ISLAND AS WELL ASPROVIDE TOOLS TO SD FARMERS AND SD BEGINNING FARMERS TO ENHANCE THEIRSUCCESSES AND FINANCIAL VIABILITY. SUSTAINABLE MOLOKAI AIMS TO ADDRESSTHE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH COLLABORATE WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERSTO OFFER 4 DIFFERENT AGRICULTURAL EDUCATION/TRAINING PROGRAMS AS WELL ASTECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND USDA PROGRAM COORDINATION IN ORDER TO FOSTERTHE DEVELOPMENT AND EXPANSION OF SD FARMERS AND SD BEGINNING FARMERS.THEY INCLUDE: (1) EGG PRODUCTION WORKSHOPS, (2) A UNIVERSITY OF HAWAIICOLLEGE OF TROPICAL AGRICULTURE AND HUMAN RESOURCES (UH CTAHR) CHICKENCROP FORAGING WORKSHOP, (3) AGRICULTURAL INTERNSHIPS (4) GOFARM HAWAIIAGBUSINESS WORKSHOPS, AND (5) USDA PROGRAM COORDINATION.
